duties_responsibilities.duty: Support the coordination, integration, communication, implementation and evaluation of nursing practice and clinical policies and procedures.
Participate in site and organizational quality and performance improvement activities.
Collect patient healthcare data systematically using appropriate assessment techniques and instruments.
Develop patient-centered plans of care that prescribe interventions to attain expected outcomes.
Provide comprehensive care including administration of treatments and medication, disease prevention guidance, and rehabilitation care.
Assess and monitor patient responses to various treatments, procedures, and anesthesia.
Perform physical examinations, diagnostic tests, and onsite testing (e.g., POC lab testing, EKG, specimen collection).
Record patient health history and information in electronic health record.
Administer medications, provide comprehensive wound care, and perform phone and in-person patient triage for clinical concerns.
Support patient care in a healing, humane, and caring environment.
Coordinate and facilitate patient care with other health care providers.
Implement interventions identified in the plan of care and educate patients and families for healthy adjustment to new or changed health patterns.
Measure and report on the performance of patient care, using data-driven insights to continuously improve care practices.

education_certification.credential: Baccalaureate degree in Nursing is highly preferred; a Diploma or Associates Degree in Nursing requires a minimum of one year experience in conjunction with plans to earn a baccalaureate degree required. Current Registered Professional Nurse in New York licensure is required. BCLS is also required.
